tutorial.title: Linktree - Part 2
tutorial.descriptionContent: Get ready to build your very own Linktree-style page, where you can showcase all your socials and other links you care about in one spot.

executableContent.instructions:
Welcome back to your project! Before we start styling it, we need to do some housekeeping. For this to be a correct website.

1. Start by adding opening and closing `body` tags to the beginning (top) and end (bottom) of your HTML document.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Emmy

Aspiring Software Developer

Welcome to my page!

Instagram TikTok
files.solvedContent:
Emmy

Aspiring Software Developer

Welcome to my page! I'm Emmy, an aspiring software developer. Follow my journey by checking out my social media profiles. Happy coding!

Instagram TikTok

executableContent.instructions:
Now, let's add `<html>` tags to the beginning (top) and end (bottom) of your HTML document. 

1. Add `html` tags or use AI to do it for you.

executableContent.instructions:
Some elements provide information to the browser but aren't displayed on the web page. The `head` element contains such elements and is placed inside the `html` element above your `body` element.

1. Create the `head` opening and closing tags at the top of your HTML document.

executableContent.instructions:
It's finally time for some CSS.

1. First, ask AI to link the stylesheet to your HTML file.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's start styling by aligning the text to the center of the page. We can apply styles to the entire page by targeting the `body` element.

1. Create a `body` selector by adding `body { }` in the CSS file.
2. Within the selector, set `text-align` to `center`.

Use AI if you don't remember the exact syntax.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's add some colors to make the page look better.

1. Inside the `body` selector, set `background-color` to `slateblue` or any other color you like.

executableContent.instructions:
As the last step of part 2, we need to define a text color that has a high contrast to the background so that the text is easier to read.

1. Set `color` to a color you like (if you chose `slateblue` for the background, try `white` as the text color).

You can also ask AI to suggest a color.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Nice work adding structure and some styling to your page. Next, you'll learn how to make your page stand out with more sophisticated CSS.

1. Feel free to make more changes to your project and continue when you're done.
